column1: The Petarukan train collision occurred on 2 October 2010
column3: in Pemalang Regency of Central Java
column5: when two intercity trains collided with each other. Thirty-six people died as a result of the accident

column2: an Argo Bromo Anggrek executive train travelling from Jakarta to Surabaya ran into the rear of a Senja Utama Semarang business train at Petarukan
column3: Pemalang a city on the north coast of central Java. The Argo Bromo executive train had 336 passengers on board
column4: while the Senja Utama Semarang business train was bound for Semarang and carrying 663 passengers. The location of the crash was at track 4 of Petarukan station. The Argo Bromo Anggrek train was supposed to pass the slower Senja Utama Semarang train (which was waiting to be passed at track 4)
column6: but it passed a danger signal and eventually rear-ended the waiting train. Three carriages derailed and overturned
column7: 36 people were reported to have been killed and 50 injured
column8: with the death toll expected to rise. The accident was the deadliest in Indonesia since the Bintaro train crash on 19 October 1987
